children.subject: Have not taken 127 with him. But he is a good professor as far as I am concerned. I took EECS 126 with him, and found him to be a decent lecturer. Nice person, and he tries to make the course manageable(I believe he lowered the overall workload of 126 our semester). I had some friends take EECS 16A with him, and they concur.

history.content: I believe this is his first time teaching EECS 127. I have taken EECS 126 and EECS 16A with Courtade, so I can comment a bit. First, I think he is a good lecturer. While he can be a bit dry sometimes, he explains things pretty clearly. If you follow along with the lectures, you'll probably be okay. In this regard, I think he's better than Prof Ghaoui, so if you do plan on taking 127, this would be the semester to do so, As for the difficulty, his exams are usually pretty fair. The class is graded on a curve anyways, and the material in 127 isn't really that conceptually difficult.

children.subject: Courtade is a great professor! He’s very clear in his teaching (dry sometimes but moreso the material). He’s extremely responsive on Piazza while giving helpful information (basically responds in like less than an hour on average) and is very helpful in Office Hours. I would def recommend him!

history.content: Has anyone taken EECS 127 with Thomas Courtade? Can you comment on the difficulty/workload? Or has anyone taken classes in general with him? I have heard very little about him.
history.subject: EECS 127 with Courtade?
